alert.note: Alert for Lexington; Richland (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 27 at 12:01AM EDT until June 27 at 12:45AM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central South Carolina, including the following areas, Lexington and Richland. * WHEN...Until 200 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1200 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Columbia, West Columbia, Cayce, Irmo, Forest Acres, Springdale, Dentsville, St. Andrews, Oak Grove, Highway 6 at Lake Murray Dam, Arcadia Lakes, Columbia International University, Riverbanks Zoo, Five Points, West Columbia Riverwalk, Harbison State Forest, Killian, Woodfield, SC State Fair Grounds and Sesquicentennial State Park. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 126 between mile markers 0 and 3. Interstate 26 between mile markers 97 and 112. Interstate 20 in South Carolina between mile markers 60 and 83. Interstate 77 between mile markers 10 and 24. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooded roadways are nearly impossible to see at night. Avoid traveling in this area. Turn around, don`t drown.
